STR :

1. Have an identity set to sign all outgoing messages using a S/Mime certificate
2. switch Thunderbird to Offline mode
3. compose  a message with this identity and press send later :

Results :
"Unable to save your message in order to send it later.
Unable to sign message. Please check that the certificates specified in Mail & Newsgroups Account Settings for this mail account are valid and trusted"

Expected results the windows goes away and my mail ends up in the sent later folder (which name esâces me right now).

If I take the other identity on that account (and that one is the primary one). This identity doesn't sign anything and doesn't have a certificate.  on step 3 the email composition windows goes away.

There is nothing in Tools -> error console.

the account is my mozilla imap account and it keeps drafts in the draft folder of xxxx@mozilla.com (ie the main identity - second example in the explanations above).

Filing into security as this looks like an issue when signing emails.
